sen.j: 三条実綱（さんじょう さねつな、永禄5年（1562年）‐天正9年2月7日 (旧暦)（1581年3月11日））は、室町時代後期から安土桃山時代の公卿。
sen.e: Sanetsuna SANJO (1562-March 11, 1581) was Kugyo (the top court official) who lived from the late Muromachi period to the Azuchi-Momoyama period.
Sanetsuna SANJO (1562-March 11, 1581) was Kugyo (a top court official) who lived from the late Muromachi to the Azuchi-Momoyama period.
Sanetsuna SANJO (1562 - March 21, 1581) was a Kugyo (a top court official) who lived from the late Muromachi to the Azuchi-Momoyama period.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: 主に正親町天皇（106代）の代に朝廷に仕えていたが、早世したために清華家三条家の当主でありながら生前の官位は正三位止まりであった。
sen.e: Though he served the Imperial Court mainly in the generation of the Emperor Googimachi (the one hundred and sixth), he promoted only to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) in spite of the family head of the Seiga family/the Sanjo family because of his premature death.

Though he served the Imperial Court mainly in the generation of the Emperor Googimachi (the 106th), he was promoted only to Shosanmi (Senior 3rd Rank) in spite of the family head of the Seiga family/the Sanjo family because of his premature death.

Although he served the Imperial Court mainly in the generation of the Emperor Ogimachi (the 106th), he was promoted only to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) in spite of being the family head of the Sanjo family, which is a Seiga family (one of the highest court noble families in Japan at that time), because of his premature death.
sen.cmt: Ogimachi としました。「清華家である三条家」 という表現にしました。

sen.j: 惜しまれて死後に右大臣を追贈されている。
sen.e: He was raised to Udaijin (minister of the right) after he died and was sadly missed.
He was raised to Udaijin (minister of the right) after he died and was sadly missed.
He was raised to Udaijin (Minister of the Right) after he died and was sadly missed.
sen.cmt: 他と合わせ、Minsiter of the Right と大文字にしました。

sen.e: His original name was Kinnobu SANJO.
His original name was Kinnobu SANJO.
His original name was Kinnobu SANJO.

sen.j: 実父は内大臣三条西実枝。
sen.e: His biological father was Naidaijin (minister) Saneki SANJONISHI.
His biological father was Naidaijin (minister) Saneki SANJONISHI.
His biological father was Naidaijin (Minister of the Center) Saneki SANJONISHI.
sen.cmt: 内大臣→Minister of the Center としました。

sen.j: 兄に三条西公国がいる。
sen.e: His elder brother was Kinkuni SANJONISHI.
His elder brother was Kinkuni SANJONISHI.
His elder brother was Kinkuni SANJONISHI.

sen.j: 三条家の分家正親町三条家の分家三条西家に生まれた。
sen.e: He was from the Sanjonishi family, the branch family of the Ogimachisanjo family which was also the branch family of the Sanjo family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He was from the Sanjonishi family, the branch family of the Ogimachisanjo family which was also a branch family of the Sanjo family.
He was from the Sanjonishi family, the branch family of the Ogimachisanjo family which was also a branch family of the Sanjo family.

sen.j: しかし、本家筋の三条家の当主の三条公頼が周防国へ下向していた際に大寧寺の変に巻き込まれて殺され、嗣子もなかったため、三条家を相続した。
sen.e: However, he succeeded the Sanjo family because Kinyori SANJO who was the family head of the Sanjo family, the main branch of its family did not have a heir when he got involved and was killed in Daineiji no hen (the revolt of Daineiji) in going down to Suo Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, he succeeded the Sanjo family because Kinyori SANJO the family head, the main branch of its family did not have an heir when he got involved and was killed in Daineiji no hen (the revolt of Daineiji) when he went to Suo Province.

However, he succeeded the Sanjo family because Kinyori SANJO, the family head of the main branch of its family, did not have an heir when he got involved and was killed in the revolt of Dainei-ji Temple while he served in Suo Province.
sen.cmt: 一部翻訳を修正しました。

sen.e: He ennobled in 1569.
He ennobled in 1569.
He was conferred peerage in 1569.
sen.cmt: 叙爵→conferred peerage と統一しました。

sen.j: その後、清華家として速いスピードで出世し、幼くして侍従・近衛府などをつとめ、天正8年（1580年）までには正三位・中納言となっていたが、その翌年に早世している。
sen.e: Later, he promoted at a fast pace in the Seiga family and served as jiju (a chamberlain), Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards) and other positions in his early years until he became Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank), Chunagon (middle counselor) by 1580, but he died young the next year.

Later, he was promoted at a fast pace in the Seiga family and served as jiju (chamberlain), Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards) and other positions in his early years until he became Shosanmi (Senior 3rd Rank), Chunagon (middle counselor) by 1580, but he died young the next year.

Later, he was promoted at a fast pace as a member of the Seiga family and served as jiju (chamberlain), Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards) and other positions in his early years until he became Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank), Chunagon (vice-councilor of state) by 1580, but he died young the next year.
sen.cmt: 中納言 補足を変更しました。3rd →Third としました。

sen.e: He died at the age of 20.
He died at the age of 20.
He died at the age of 20.

sen.j: 実兄の三条西公国の次男三条公広が三条家を相続した。
sen.e: Kinhiro SANJO, the second son of Kinkuni SANJONISHI who was the biological elder brother of Sanetsuna succeeded the Sanjo family.
Kinhiro SANJO, the second son of Kinkuni SANJONISHI, the biological elder brother of Sanetsuna, succeeded the Sanjo family.
Kinhiro SANJO, the second son of Kinkuni SANJONISHI, the biological elder brother of Sanetsuna, succeeded the Sanjo family.
